description.en:
The content of the course consists of three categories that are
1.	Using MATLAB in Biology
In this category, we use System Biology toolbox of MATLAB for computational biology in order to do these tasks:
* Import, analyse, and model data, and share results.
* Automate workflow elements.
* Customize algorithms and tools critical to developing innovative methods for working with unexplored research areas.
* Leverage proven, commercially supported algorithms and tool.
2.	Using MATLAB in Bio Engineering 
In this category, we talk about topics in this field which MATLAB can do them such as:
* Types and sources of numerical error
* Systems of linear equations
* Hypothesis testing
* Root finding techniques for nonlinear equations
* Numerical quadrature
* Numerical integration of ordinary differential equations
* Nonlinear data regression and optimization
* Basic algorithms of bioinformatics
3.	Using MATLAB in Physic and chemistry 
In this category we talk about some physics and chemistry algorithms that are implemented in MATLAB such as:
* Solar systems
* Potential and Field.
* Waves
* Random systems
* Determination of the stoichiometric coefficients in a chemical equation.
description.et:
Kursus on jagatud kolmeks osaks
1.	MATLAB kasutus bioloogias
Kasutatakse System Biology lisamoodulit:
*	Andmete importimiseks, analüüsimiseks ning jagamiseks
*	Tegevuste automatiseerimiseks
*	Algoritmide ning oskuste omandamiseks, mis on vajalikud, et töötada seni uurimata teadusvaldkondades.
*	Kasutamaks testitud ning toetatud algoritme ja töövahendeid.
2.	MATLAB kasutus bioinseneerias
*	Numbriliste meetodite veahinnang
*	Lineaarvõrrandisüsteemid 
*	Hüpoteeside testimine
*	Mittelineaarsete võrrandite lahendamine
*	Numbrilised integreerimismeetodid
*	Numbrilised meetodi tavaliste diferentsiaalvõrrandite lahendamiseks
*	Mittelineaarne regressioonianalüüs ning optimeerimine
*	Bioinformaatika baasalgoritmid
3.	MATALB kasutus füüsikas ning keemias
*	Planeedisüsteemid
*	Potentsiaal ja väli
*	Lained
*	Juhuslikud süsteemid
*	Stöhhiomeetriliste koefitsientide hindamine keemilises võrrandis

objectives.en: The challenge of the course is to develop the modelling skills of students in order to prepare themselves for technical courses that they will take in the coming semesters. Students will learn how to simulate the systems and analyse the results of those simulation. Introducing MATLAB and SIMULINK and all their toolboxes are other important objectives of this course. Students will also start to develop their skills in critical thinking within this course by learning various examples of applied mathematical models and statistical approaches used in tackling the real problems
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on arendada tudengite modelleermisoskust, et valmistada neid ette tulevaste semestrite tehnilisteks aineteks. Tudengid õpivad, kuidas simuleerida süsteeme ning seejärel tulemusi analüüsida. MATLAB-i ning SIMULINK-i tööriistade tutvustamine on samuti kursuse eesmärgiks. Tudengid arendavad enda kriitilise mõtlemise oskuseid õppides erinevaid rakenduslikke matemaatilisi mudeleid ning statistilisi lähenemisi päris probleemide lahendamisteled, kes võiksid kasutada MATLAB'i ja SIMULINK'I kogu õppeaja jooksul mitmesugustes projektides..

learning_outcomes.en: *	By the end of this course it is expected that the learners will learn about applied way of combing their knowledge on programming, math and statistics with their biology, material science and bioengineering knowledge.
learning_outcomes.et: *	Kursuse lõpuks oskavad osalejad kombineerida oma teadmisi programmeerimise, matemaatika ning statistika vallast teadmistega bioloogiast, materjaliteaduses ning bioinseneeriast, et lahendada tekkida võivaid praktilisi ülesandeid.

learning_outcomes.en: *	The learners will develop their programming skills in MATLAB environment and will get familiar with different toolboxes in there.
learning_outcomes.et: *	Osalejad arendavad enda programmeerimise oskusi kasutades MATLAB keskkonda. Nad oskavad kasutada MATLAB'i lisasid.

learning_outcomes.en: *	The learners will develop their critical thinking skills

grade_preconditions.et:
Minimum attendance required for practical sessions: 70%
Final grades are obtained from five homeworks (10% each, 50% in total) and final exam (50%).

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials: * Note: The course materials will be partially available online via Moodle and students are responsible to attend the course.
resources.recommended_materials:
MATLAB online documentation
Cormen, T.H., 2009. Introduction to algorithms. MIT press.
Moler, C.B., 2004. Numerical computing with MATLAB. Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics.
